listData.name: Macquarie Basic Home Loan
listData.description: A low rate home loan with no application or account management fees.

features.additionalInfo: Access additional payments you've made through the redraw facility. Redraw cannot be accessed on fixed rate loan accounts until after the fixed period expires.

Have up to 6 loan accounts. Each loan account can be set up with either principal and interest or interest only repayments for up to 5 years (subject to credit approval). Each loan account can also be set up with either a variable rate or a fixed rate for periods of 1-5 years. Repayments are due monthly.

Access to online banking and mobile banking app. Pay Anyone available with a $100,000 daily limit across all eligible accounts linked to a Macquarie ID for customers who use the Macquarie Authenticator App and a daily limit of $2,000 for customers without Authenticator. BPAYÂ® out available up to the available balance of your account.
Construction Loans. Borrowers can draw down their home loan in stages to fund their renovation or new home build
Repayments can be made via Direct Debit or Salary Credit/Electronic Funds Transfer.
Minimum increase amount $25,000.
Maximum Loan term of up to 30 years.

Extra repayments can be made in addition to regular monthly loan repayments. Note: You can make extra repayments on your fixed home loan of up to $10,000 per account which can be made each year without penalty (additional payments above this amount may incur break costs). The 12-month period is calculated from the date the fixed term commenced.
Subject to review, a guarantor can be nominated during the loan origination process.

constraints.additionalInfo: Minimum new loan amount $150,000.
Maximum new loan amount $10,000,000.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Minimum age requirement.
Lending criteria, fees and T&Cs apply.

fees.name: Construction Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A one-off fee payable at settlement which covers valuation costs and progress payments during construction period.

fees.name: Break Cost
fees.additionalInfo: Break costs may be payable on early repayment during fixed rate periods if any of the following three events occur: 1. The whole of a fixed rate Loan Account is repaid. 2. The borrower makes additional repayments in excess of $10,000 into a fixed rate Loan Account in any year of the fixed rate term (i.e. in any 12 months from the date the fixed rate period commences). 3. The borrower changes the whole or part of the fixed rate Loan Account to another type of interest rate or repayment type, including changing to a different fixed rate period. The break cost could be substantial. Contact us for further information.

fees.name: Documentation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to the Lender in relation to preparing your loan documents and arranging settlement.

fees.name: Low Deposit Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applicable for loans with an LVR >80%, where a once off amount is payable by the borrower, in connection with the low deposit being paid, and/or the low amount of equity the borrower has in the security property.

fees.name: Special Attendance Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if the borrower requests a special service (for example consenting to a dealing with the Mortgage Property), in addition to any third party fees.

fees.name: Third Party Fees
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if the Lender incurs a fee from any third party, including our solicitors, as a result of any matter relating to the Loan Agreement or Security after the Settlement Date. This fee includes GST.

fees.name: Mortgage Discharge Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you request a full discharge of any Mortgage, in addition to any third party fees.

fees.name: Third party Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Lender incurs a fee from any third party, including our solicitors, as a result of any matter relating to the settlement of your loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Borrowers must be Company, Partnership or Trust.

Security must be business assets, residential or commercial property or cash. Business assets include rent roll, strata roll, goodwill, debtors and WIP. A General Security Agreement (GSA) will generally be issued to secure the loan. Commercial property must be within Sydney (Newcastle, Central Coast, Lake Macquarie, Maitland, Wollongong, Port Stephens), Melbourne (Ballarat, Bendigo, Geelong), Brisbane (Gold Coast, Sunshine Coast), Canberra, Perth and Adelaide metropolitan areas.

Industries we service. We specialise in accounting, architecture, engineering, financial services, healthcare, insolvency, insurance, legal, real estate, strata management, surveying, technology, High Net Worth, and Professional Property Investors industries.

Maximum LVR - Medical Professionals, General Practitioners, Day and Short Stay Hospitals, Diagnostic: Up to 3.5x EBITDA*, or 70% of external valuation. Up to 2 year interest only. Interest only ongoing up to 1.5x EBITDA*. Veterinary Clinic (Vet), Dental Services: Up to 3 x EBITDA*, or 70% of external valuation. Up to 2 year interest only. Interest only ongoing up to 1.5x EBITDA* Up to 80% LVR for commercial owner-occupied property. Interest only terms also available.

Maximum LVR - Engineers, Architects, Planners, Surveyors, associated service providers in Built Environment: up to 3.0x EBITDA* subject to business turnover and number of guarantors. Legal: For 2 partners, up to 1x yearly stabilised earnings per partner (capped at $500k per partner). For 3 or more partners, up to 1x yearly stabilised earnings per partner (capped at $1m per partner).

Maximum LVR - Legal: For 2 partners, up to 1x yearly stabilised earnings per partner (capped at $500k per partner). For 3 or more partners, up to 1x yearly stabilised earnings per partner (capped at $1m per partner).
Maximum LVR - Accounting: The lower of: a. Up to 3.5x EBITDA* (additional debt to EBITDA limits apply above $1mil) b. Up to 70% of recurring fees c. Up to $2m debt per guarantor.

Maximum LVR - Financial Planning: a. For Self-licensed Firms the lower of up to 3.75x EBITDA* or 67% loan to value ratio***. b. For Corporate Authorised Representatives the lower of up to 3.3x EBITDA* or 60% loan to value ratio***. *** LVR based on 2.3 x recurring wealth income plus 2.5 x recurring risk income

Maximum LVR - Insurance Broking: a. For recurring revenue â¤$1m, up to 60% of asset value determined by internal Macquarie Multiplier and amortising b. For recurring revenue >$1m, up to 4x EBITDA* amortising c. Interest Only (IO) terms may be considered for recurring revenue >$1m, IO ongoing up to 3x EBITDA*.
Maximum LVR - Real Estate: Up to a maximum of 70% of rent roll value determined by internal Macquarie Multiplier (no cost to client) and must amortise to 60% within 3 years.

Maximum LVR - Strata: a. Where lots under management <5,000 and all WA based strata managers, up to a maximum of 70% of strata roll value b. Where lots under management â¥5,000 excluding all WA based strata managers, up to 4.5x EBITDA*. c. Business Valuations determined by internal Macquarie Multiplier (no cost to client) d. Ongoing Interest Only (IO) available at maximum LVR.

Maximum LVR - IT Services: Typically, revenue of >$3m. When revenue â¥$30m, maximum lending of 3x EBITDA*. When revenue <$30m, maximum lending of 2x EBITDA*. Interest Only (IO) is available for up to 2 years. Longer terms may be considered. Software (SAAS): Typically, revenue of >$3m. Maximum lending of 3x EBITDA*. Interest Only (IO) is available for up to 2 years. Longer terms may be considered.

*Minimum loan sizes apply and will vary depending on a variety of factors. Contact us if youâd like more information. This is a guide only. EBITDA can be adjusted for items such as principal salaries, exceptional items and other factors based on individual borrower circumstances.
